Law.Title: Affordable Care Act (ACA)
Law.Who: Enacted by the United States Congress and signed into law by President Barack Obama
Law.Context: Aimed to expand access to affordable health insurance, improve healthcare quality, and reduce costs

Point.Title: Individual Mandate
Point.Description: Required most individuals to have health insurance coverage or face a penalty

Point.Title: Insurance Marketplaces
Point.Description: Established state-based or federally facilitated exchanges for individuals and small businesses to compare and purchase health insurance plans

Point.Title: Medicaid Expansion
Point.Description: Expanded Medicaid eligibility to cover more low-income individuals and families

Description.SubBullet: Prohibited insurance companies from denying coverage or charging higher premiums based on pre-existing conditions
Set limits on age-based premium variations

Point.Title: Essential Health Benefits
Point.Description: Defined a set of essential health benefits that insurance plans must cover

Point.Title: Subsidies and Tax Credits
Point.Description: Provided financial assistance to lower-income individuals and families to help them afford insurance premiums

Outcomes.Outcome: Protection for individuals with pre-existing conditions
